result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. San Felipe Morales

defendant.name: Morales, San Felipe
defendant.address: 7173 South Pennsylvania Avenue, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant San Felipe Morales appeared by video.  Attorney David Carl Bangert appeared by video for San Felipe Morales.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense counsel informed the Court this may be a deferred prosecution agreement. Defendant to schedule TAD evaluation.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant San Felipe Morales appeared by video.  Attorney David Carl Bangert appeared by video for San Felipe Morales.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court set another status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant San Felipe Morales appeared by video.  Attorney David Carl Bangert appeared by video for San Felipe Morales.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel has not received an offer from the State and is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture Case adjourned to Branch 30. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant San Felipe Morales in court with attorney David Carl Bangert.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  San Felipe Morales appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in receipt of discovery but needs an offer and requests an adjournment. Case remains calendared in Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with R.G. and H.S.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant San Felipe Morales in court with attorney David Carl Bangert.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 057110,
Payable Number: 1014237,
Receipt Number: 22RP024647,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-22-2022 @1:30p
